isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 21-SI SERIES - ALTERNATOR BENCH TEST

svcsubsecinfo.para:
The bench test procedure is used to verify that the alternator is functioning properly prior to installation on the vehicle. The test checks the alternator output in the same manner as the RATED OUTPUT CHECK
, covered earlier in this section. If bench test equipment is not available, install the alternator on the engine and repeat the RATED OUTPUT CHECK
, in this section to verify alternator operation. If bench test equipment is available, proceed as follows:

note.para: IMPORTANT: Battery should be above 12.4 volts for test results to be valid.

step1.para: Mount alternator in suitable test stand, according to test stand manufacturer's instructions. Test stand must be capable of driving generator at speeds up to 6500 rpm.

With carbon pile load turned off, make electrical connections as shown in Figure 31. Battery voltage and ground polarity must be same as system used in the vehicle. Check and record battery voltage before proceeding with test.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. MAKE GROUND CONNECTION AT ALTERNATOR LAST

step1.para: With carbon pile load still turned off, slowly increase alternator speed to 3000 rpm and observe voltmeter.
If voltage does not increase and remains at or below previous reading (Step 2), there is no alternator output. Skip to Step 5.

If voltage increases above 15 volts, voltage is uncontrolled. Recheck alternator for proper assembly. Assure that test tab in (D) hole is not grounded. If alternator has been assembled properly, replace regulator as described under REPAIR PROCEDURE
.
If voltage is proper, proceed to next step.
With alternator running at about 6500 rpm, turn on carbon pile load and adjust to obtain maximum alternator output on ammeter without allowing voltage on voltmeter to fall below 13 volts.

If ammeter reading is within 15 amps of cold output shown under SPECIFICATIONS
alternator is good. Turn off carbon pile and stop test.

If ammeter reading is more than 15 amps below SPECIFICATIONS
alternator is not operating properly. Proceed to Step 10.
